title: Strontium-90 pollution can be bioremediated with the green microalga Tetraselmis chui
content:
Environ. Sci.: Processes Impacts, 2024, 26,622-631
DOI: 10.1039/D3EM00336A, Paper
Open Access

Inés Segovia-Campos, Anastasios Kanellakopoulos, Ivan John Barrozo, Edouard Fock-Chin-Ming, Montserrat Filella, Axel Baxarias Fontaine, Stavroula Pallada, Gilles Triscone, Karl Perron, Daniel Ariztegui
The high strontium-90 uptake by the green microalga Tetraselmis chui is related to its ability to form strontium-rich inclusions of amorphous calcium carbonate (called micropearls).
